description: From Latin acervātus, perfect passive participle of acervō (“heap or pile up”), from acervus (“heap”).

adjectives.description: acervate (comparative more acervate, superlative most acervate)

entries.meaning: (chiefly botany, rare) Heaped, or growing in heaps, or closely compacted clusters.

verbs.description: acervate (third-person singular simple present acervates, present participle acervating, simple past and past participle acervated)
